markdown:
Skelms crave power, and the palace skelms who stalk the halls where such power concentrates are among the most dangerous of their kind. They assume titles that allow them maximum freedom to punish or hurt others with minimal oversight: any vindictive guard captain, tyrannical viceroy, or needlessly cruel magistrate could be or become a palace skelm. They delight in the wealth and status of their positions, garbing themselves in ornate finery that reflects their station. Palace skelms ingratiate themselves with powerful individuals and gather followers by stoking fears of losing long-held or hard-earned power—especially power gained through illicit means. They undermine their enemies by encouraging competition, jealousy, and outright paranoia by way of magic and false messages. These skelms possess an unnatural ability to twist spoken words and worm their manipulative magic into others' speech, sowing confusion and hatred that might explode into violence. A political upheaval is a palace skelm's greatest fear and opportunity alike, upsetting the balance of power he has built but providing countless new opportunities to sow hatred and evil. This conflicting goal leads palace skelms to self-sabotage and undermine their own efforts more than any other skelm. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 24 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 22 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 19 [Palace Skelm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1303) **Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 240 **Perception** +15; [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33) (imprecise) 30 feet **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1); [_tongues_](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +18, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +21, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +17, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +17, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +16, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +16, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +16, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) +16 **Str** +6 **Dex** +4 **Con** +3 **Int** +4 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +5 **Items** signet ring --- **AC** 27 **Fort** +17 **Ref** +16 **Will** +15 –2 to all saves vs. [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60) effects **HP** 155 **Weaknesses** [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 10 **Corrupt Speech** ([auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=101), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) **Trigger** The skelm hears a creature speak within 30 feet; **Effect** The skelm sows paranoia by putting treacherous words on another's lips. The skelm whispers up to 12 words and attempts a [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) check against the Perception DC of a creature other than the triggering creature within 30 feet.
**Critical Success** The target hears the skelm's words as if they were spoken by the triggering creature. This can alter [linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=101) effects. The skelm also casts [_paranoia_](/Spells.aspx?ID=214) or [_suggestion_](/Spells.aspx?ID=315) on the target, if he likes.
**Success** As critical success, except the skelm can't cast _paranoia_ or _suggestion_.
**Failure** The target doesn't hear the skelm's words, and they have no effect.
**Critical Failure** The target hears the skelm speak the words. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** fist +20 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 2d8+9 bludgeoning plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **Melee** antler +20 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 2d12+9 piercing plus [Knockdown](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=20) **Occult Innate Spells** DC 26 - **Cantrips (5th)** [Daze](/Spells.aspx?ID=61), [Message](/Spells.aspx?ID=190) - **2nd** [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164) (×3) - **4th** [Clairaudience](/Spells.aspx?ID=39), [Enthrall](/Spells.aspx?ID=104), [Outcast's Curse](/Spells.aspx?ID=211), [Paranoia](/Spells.aspx?ID=214) (at will), [Private Sanctum](/Spells.aspx?ID=235), [Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315) - **Constant (5th)** [Tongues](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **Rituals** DC 26 - **2nd** [Inveigle](/Rituals.aspx?ID=14) **[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=8)** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) The palace skelm can take on the appearance of any Medium male [humanoid](/Traits.aspx?ID=91). This doesn't change his Speed or his attack and damage bonuses with his Strikes but might change the damage type his Strikes deal. **Incite Violence** ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** The skelm gives an impassioned speech calling for his followers to act upon their convictions. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a DC 24 Will save.
**Critical Success** The creature can immediately Strike an adjacent creature of its choosing.
**Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Failure** The creature immediately Strikes an adjacent creature; if multiple creatures are adjacent, the skelm chooses the target. If no creatures are adjacent, the creature is [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) and [fascinated](/Conditions.aspx?ID=14) with the skelm until the start of its next turn.
